description: This trap message is reported when the system database is being saved.
The count of saving the system configurations.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwConfigSN

description: This trap message, indicating the synchronization progress, is reported during the data synchronization
between the active and standby control boards.

event.Summary: Synchronization progress between active and standby control boards

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwSynScheduleTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwSynSchedulguage i 9999

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Progress of the synchronization between the active and standby control boards.
Range: 0-100
variables.name: HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwSynSchedulguage

description: This trap is reported when configuration file starts to be saved.
Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: This trap is reported when configuration file is saved completely.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwSaveConfigCompleteTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwTrapSaveResult i 9999

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Result of the data saving.
The returned value 0 indicates that the data is saved successfully.
The returned value 1 indicates that the data saving fails.
variables.name: HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwTrapSaveResult

description: This trap is reported when the switchover occurs between the active and standby boards.

event.Summary: Switchover occurred between active and standby boards

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-SWITCHOVER-MIB::hwSwitchoverTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0

description: This trap is reported when the system batch hot backup starts.
This trap is reported when the system batch hot backup is complete.
This trap is reported when the system enters the in-service upgrade scenario.
This trap is reported when software versions of active and standby boards are inconsistent.

event.Summary: Software versions of active and standby boards are inconsistent
